title: Lemon Garlic Spaghetti with Cherry Tomatoes

instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add spaghetti and cook until al dente based on package instructions.
Do not overcook — it will finish briefly in the sauce.
tips: Water should taste slightly salty like seawater.

instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and red pepper flakes.
tips: Lower heat if sizzling too aggressively.

instructions: Add cherry tomatoes into the skillet.
tips: Gently press tomatoes to help release juices.
Sweet cherry tomatoes work best for flavor balance.

instructions: Before draining, reserve 1/2 cup pasta cooking water.
tips: Starchy pasta water helps bind and thicken sauce.

instructions: Add drained spaghetti to the tomato skillet.
Pour in lemon juice and a splash of reserved pasta water.
Toss gently to form a glossy, light sauce.
tips: Adjust sauce thickness with pasta water — a little goes a long way.
Taste and rebalance with lemon or salt.

instructions: Turn off heat and sprinkle grated Parmesan (optional).
Tear basil by hand and mix in gently.
tips: Do not cook basil — keep it fresh for aroma.
Add extra lemon for a brighter flavor profile.
